intro: Cyrtandra crockerella, commonly known as Crocker's pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in montane rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
